titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the John M. Levinson papers 84061.4089793
titlestmt.author: Megan Moholt and Katherine Reynolds

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-05-10 09:11:11 -0700.

change.item: Revised to include additional manuscript box added after album fO was rehoused by Preservation. - Paige Davenport

data cleanup via script: updated the author of the finding aid; removed trailing comma and/or lowered the case of last phrase in the title; removed markup tags, removed trailing comma, lower cased last phrase in findingAidTitle; removed markup tags, removed trailing comma, lower cased last phrase in findingAidFilingTitle; removed tags from languageOfFindingAid; removed markup tags in the Revision Description; added catkey; added OAC url; remove comma before the closing title tag; removed tags; updated Prefered Citation; updated Accruals statement
Revised to update encoding and add unitid
Original EAD-to-ArchivistsToolkit import from file reg_288.sgm, converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl

physdesc.extent: 31 manuscript boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 14 envelopes, 1 album box, 1 phonotape cassette

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, conference proceedings, reports, studies, memoranda, correspondence, pamphlets, hearing transcripts, serials, clippings, other printed matter, and photographs, relating to medical conditions in Vietnam and elsewhere in Indochina, private American medical and other relief assistance to Vietnam, and the medical effects of use of defoliants and herbicides in Vietnam during the Vietnamese War. Includes postage stamps issued by the governments of French Indochina, Cambodia, Laos, and North and South Vietnam, 1889-1974.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least two business days in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John M. Levinson papers, [Box no., Folder no. or title], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1984.

chronitem.event: Made various trips to Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia
Lobbied for Volunteer Physicians for Viet Nam Program
Became consultant to Edward M. Kennedy's U.S. Senate Subcommittee to Investigate Problems Connected with Refugees and Escapees
Participated in Subcommittee study missions to Vietnam
Served on CARE-MEDICO board of directors

eventgrp.event: Became consultant to U.S. Veterans Administration
Associate Professor of Obstetrics and Gynecology at Jefferson Medical College, Philadelphia
Made various trips to Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia
Lobbied for Volunteer Physicians for Viet Nam Program
Became consultant to Edward M. Kennedy's U.S. Senate Subcommittee to Investigate Problems Connected with Refugees and Escapees
Participated in Subcommittee study missions to Vietnam
Served on CARE-MEDICO board of directors
Became consultant to U.S. Veterans Administration
Associate Professor of Obstetrics and Gynecology at Jefferson Medical College, Philadelphia

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.p: Includes notes and typewritten copies of speeches, synopsis of proposed book, and printed articles arranged chronologically by date of publication or writing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings, printed articles pamphlets, monographs, serials, reports, maps, memoranda, correspondence, hearing transcripts, conference proceedings and papers, and travel itineraries arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes stamps, albums, and catalogs arranged alphabetically by name of country.

did.unittitle: Stamps, grouped by subject in envelopes
Stamps, grouped by subject in envelopes
Southeast Asia - Album. Includes stamps from Kampuchea, Laos, and Vietnam

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes postage stamps, scrapbooks and printed material arranged by physical format.

did.unittitle: Postage stamps, album pages of Indochina stamps
National Agent Orange Conference Call, Veterans Administration
10 photographs of medical assistance and training given by the Thomas A. Dooley Foundation in Laos
16 post cards of sculptures in the Tay Phuong pagoda, North Vietnam
2 miscellaneous post cards and 20 miscellaneous negatives, including views of canoeing and John M. Levinson
3 photographs and 1 negative of Tu Du Maternity Hospital, Saigon, Vietnam, including view of John M. Levinson

2 photographs of Senator Edward M. Kennedy and John M. Levinson during U.S. Senate Committee on the Judiciary, Subcommittee to Investigate Problems Connected with Refugees and Escapees study mission to Vietnam

1 photograph, 1 contact sheet, and 36 negatives of John M. Levinson talking to U.S. soldiers during U.S. Senate Committee on the Judiciary, subcommittee to Investigate Problems Connected with Refugees and Escapees study mission to Vietnam
25 post cards of artwork depicting Vietnamese military scenes
9 photographs of death and destruction caused by bombing in Vietnam

29 photographs of U.S. Senate Committee on the Judiciary, Subcommittee to Investigate Problems Connected with Refugees and Escapees study mission to Vietnam, including views of bombed hospitals, war monument, John M. Levinson
25 photographs of hospital conditions, surgery, and patients, Cambodia
14 photographs and 15 negatives of defoliation, surgery, birth defects during study of Agent Orange in Vietnam

100 photographs and 102 negatives of the International Symposium on the Long-Term Ecological and Human Consequences of Chemical Warfare in Vietnam, Ho Chi Minh City, including views of conference, hospital visits, countryside, sightseeing
1 negative of Amerasia children, Saigon, Vietnam
69 prints depicting mainly hospitals in North and South Vietnam during and after the War
